Overview

A struct representing a cardmask

- (Object) <<(other)

Add cards from another cardmask to this set

Examples:

cardmask << other_cardmask

Parameters:

  • other (PokerEvalAPI::CardMask)

27
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 25

def << (other)
	self[:cards_n] = self[:cards_n] | other[:cards_n]
end

- (Object) any_set(m)

Returns true if any of the given cards are in the set

Parameters:

  • m (PokerEvalAPI::CardMask) —

    The cards to check



70
71
72
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 70

def any_set(m)
	return ((self[:cards_n] & m[:cards_n]) != 0)
end

def count
	return PokerEvalAPI.wrap_StdDeck_numCards(self)

- (Object) eval(i)

    The number of cards in the hand

# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 37

def eval(i)
	return PokerEvalAPI.StdDeck_StdRules_EVAL_N(self,i)
end

- (Object) is_set(i)

Returns true if the given card is in this set

Parameters:

  • i (Integer) —

    The card index to check



62
63
64
65
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 62

def is_set(i)
	mask = PokerEvalAPI.wrap_StdDeck_MASK(i)
	return any_set(mask)
end

- (Object) set(i)

Adds a single card to this set by specifying its index

Parameters:

  • i (Integer) —

    The card index to add



54
55
56
57
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 54

def set(i)
	mask = PokerEvalAPI.wrap_StdDeck_MASK(i)
	self << mask
end

- (Object) to_s

Returns a string representation of these cards



42
43
44
 
# File 'lib/pokereval.rb', line 42

def to_s
	return PokerEvalAPI.wrap_StdDeck_maskString(self).gsub(/\s+/, '')
end
